turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Jake, I'm going to ask you once -- was it self-defense?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Honest to God, Emmett, he would've killed me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I think we lost 'em.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: There's nobody coming?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Forget the money. You've got to get these people out of here. This is no place to be sitting with women and kids.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Your next water ain't for three days.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Well, Kate, it was self-defense sure enough, but I think you'd have to say I killed old Murdo. I think that's definitely the word.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It was my fault.

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: Emmett.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: McKendrick.

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: I didn't know you were out.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Did it seem short to you?

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: That's all over as far as I'm concerned, Emmett. I'm satisfied.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Sounds good.

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: All right then.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Wait a minute. Get down off of there, Augie.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: After the war my family worked a little piece of land near Savannah for a while. But the way it was down there then... well, they made it hard every way they could. Finally my daddy figured the promised land was out this direction. By that time I was so sick of farming, I didn't want to touch another hoe ever. I wouldn't come with 'em. My daddy took it pretty hard. Him, my ma, and my little sister headed out without me. They've got a little place south of Silverado. I guess they've done okay. Good enough anyway so that when my ma wrote me last time, she said they needed my help to work the place. That was almost nine months ago she wrote. Letter took a while to find me, but when it did, it was just the right time.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Chicago. Working in the slaughter- houses.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Maybe we'll see you sometime.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Yeah... maybe. So long.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: ...Gotta go...

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Someplace safe. How you feeling?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'd be worse if you hadn't come along.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: I didn't just come along. I was looking for you.  Jake said you were out there. I saw him in town, and he told me about that business the other night. Said you boys took a Henry off one of McKendrick's men. I wanted to see it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: This was my father's. The men who killed him took it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I gotta get to my brother. If they came after me, they'll want him too.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: You'll never make it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Have to.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: I'll go. I'll bring Jake out here.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Be careful. You're in it now. And it's gonna get mean.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: So far that's all I seen in this life.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: I almost didn't.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Where's Jake?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: McKendrick's men got him.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Is he alive?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Kate?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: She was hurt... pretty bad.  Emmett, they took the little boy with them.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Gotta go.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: More than enough.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Have you thought at all about your plans?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Some. I've been talking to the Parkers. One thing I know I'm not doing -- I'm not going back.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: The Parkers seem like nice folks.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: They've been kind to me.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Paden sends his best.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I guess I put a good scare into him.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm surprised to see you out here tonight.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I just came out to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Goodbye?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Yeah, me and Jake will be heading out for California soon.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You came all the way out here to tell me you're going to California? All you had to do was go, and we'd never see each other again.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: That's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You don't make it easy on a fellow.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Didn't Paden tell you that?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Maybe you thought you'd be back this way someday.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Yeah... that must have been it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: This is a brutal land.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You must have known that before you came.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It's one thing to know it...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: We told Sheriff Cobb about the attack.  He said he'd... look into it.  I can't believe he's the law out here. Now I see why you all wear guns.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: How's Mr. Parker doing?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Just like you'd think. But he's not going to run. We're sticking to our plan. Now we both need help.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Weren't you going to come out to say good-bye?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I already did that.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: This time you're really going?  You know where I'll be.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: That I do.

turns.speaker: HOBART
turns.text: I've got my people sitting down there...  ...swatting flies and raring to go.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'm afraid it is a bad start, friend, 'cause my name isn't Baxter, and he ain't Hawley.

turns.speaker: HOBART
turns.text: You're not Baxter?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: My name is Emmett.

turns.speaker: HOBART
turns.text: And you're not Baxter, either?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Hobart, what are you people doing here?

turns.speaker: HOBART
turns.text: This is where Baxter and Hawley brung us.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Well, they're wrong. This territory is full of bad characters.

turns.speaker: HOBART
turns.text: And they were two of them. Look --

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'm just meeting a guy here and moving on. So far I haven't been able to find him.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: In my town, when you're looking for someone, you ask me.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: All right. I'm looking for a young fella, full of juice. About my size, wears a fancy two-gun rig.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I guess tomorrow at dawn he'll be proved right.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Ten A.M.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Right... I thought they always did it at dawn.  So long, kid. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Maybe I ought to throw you in jail too. Then you could be with all your friends.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I haven't done anything.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: I want you out of town before the hanging.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'll be long gone.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Two of the horses ran off, but that pinto you're riding hung around.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You got no idea what they were after?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Offend anybody lately?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Not for five years.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Jefferson City?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: No, Leavenworth.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I've never been in there. They just jumped you out of the blue?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I had to get up anyway.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Me, I'm riding along, minding my own business. Four cowboys come by and we decide to ride together for a while, friendly as can be. I always figure you might as well approach life like everybody's your friend or nobody is... don't make much difference. We get out in the middle of that frying pan and suddenly everybody's pointing their gun but me. I guess they admired my horse. She's a great one, a sweet little bay.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Looks like that's not all they admired.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Yup. The whole rig. I don't care much about the rest, but I surely will miss that bay. Least they didn't kill me. That was right considerate, I thought. They were laughing when they left me. Thought it was real funny. I walked for a little while but there was no use, so I gave it up. Figured it was just bad luck.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Looks like those boys are headed south, so they weren't the same ones that jumped me. Which way you going?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Where's the pinto going?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I gotta stop by Turley and meet a guy.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Where's Turley?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: South of here, past Chimayo.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Maybe I'll go along as far as Chimayo. Get me some clothes. Maybe a bath.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Yeah, maybe a bath.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I see what you like, she's mighty pretty.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: And bridle-wise, too. She's the only thing I lost I really cared about.  'Cept for maybe my hat. It's a great one. Got a pretty silver band on it. My head spent three years training it.  I surely do miss that hat.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I gotta be going.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Going to Turley, was it?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Gotta meet a guy and head out for Silverado.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What's Turley like?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: It's a town...

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: They got a saloon there?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I expect.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Women?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I expect.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Doesn't look quite fair.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Which way do you mean?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Shame about the kid. Seems a lively sort.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: He is that.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I hate to see any man swing. Bad luck.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Bad luck for me. Now I gotta bust him out of there.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You'll have to deal me out on that. I've had some experience with that sort of thing, and I don't want any more.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: It's not going to be easy.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: It never is. But he's my brother.  We're going to California together. But first we're going to stop in Silverado and see our sister. And I can't show up there with a story like this.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Then I guess this is where we part ways. Sorry.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: No hard feelings.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: C'mon, I'll buy you a drink.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You haven't got any money.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: All right, you buy me a drink.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You know, hanging around with you is no picnic.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Anybody got any ideas?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Where you been?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Oh, I was just checking the, ah...  ...you know, lookin' in.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I think I'll ride along with the lady here. Just take a look at this farmland before I come into Silverado. See what makes a trip this hard worth taking.  I'll see you around.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'll be around.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Hannah's a smart, pretty woman, but she's got a hard idea for living.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: All I'm saying is, you won't trip over me if you look her up.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'm going to California with my brother.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Cobb, I want you to meet Emmett. He's a friend of mine.  This is Sheriff Cobb.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Pleased to meet you, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'll see you around.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Last one to the Midnight Star buys.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You might make a farmer yet.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I've got a job.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Daddy?

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: I saw the light. I thought maybe Rae had come back to see me. But I never thought it'd be my boy. I never thought that.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Where is Rae?

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: She's gone, gone to town. She hated working on the farm...  ...just like you.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: They run me off. They burned me out. They made it so I couldn't do. Just like Georgia. If you won't sell, they take it anyway.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: The cattle! This valley runs down to a clear creek. That's why we picked this spot, and that's why they don't want us here.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: You own this land.

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: I paid the government for it, all right. That don't mean much out here.  Malachi, I'm living like a wildcat in a cave in those hills. Hiding out, afraid to walk my own land.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: What about the law?

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: Whose law? The law here runs a man down -- just like these cattle.

turns.speaker: EZRA
turns.text: That's a lie.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Tomorrow we're going to town to straighten that out once and for all. The next day we'll be back here... farming. And these cattle better be gone.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: He acted bravely out there, Hannah. Just bad luck his getting hit. Could have been any one of us.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I don't believe in luck. I know what Conrad was like. Don't tell me what you think I want to hear.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Never will again.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: We got married just before this trip, so we could come out here and try the land. It's hard to find a man willing to take on a life like that.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Mr. and Mrs. Parker have agreed to join their parcel to mine. We'll work them together.  Mine starts right over there. It's all I've ever wanted. Pretty land, isn't it?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: And a pretty lady.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: A lot of men have told me that. Maybe it's true. I guess some women are slow to believe it.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Believe it.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: They're drawn to me by that. But it never lasts.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Because they don't like what I want.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I want to build something, make things grow. That takes hard work -- a lifetime of it. That's not why men come to a pretty woman.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: J.T.'s done everything he can. I married a brave man. Augie, take that delightful gift your uncle gave you out of here while we're talking.  McKendrick picked the new sheriff himself, so J.T. can't even get the law enforced.

turns.speaker: J.T.
turns.text: Half the gunslingers that drift into town turn up on our police force.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Augie's going to grow up here. There's nothing wrong with the land, it's just some of the people.

turns.speaker: J.T.
turns.text: The problem is, Emmett, you killed the wrong McKendrick.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why, J.T., watch what you're saying around Augie. Emmett didn't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It was not -- it was Murdo's. Those McKendricks don't know how to act like human beings.

turns.speaker: J.T.
turns.text: His son is worse than he was. He's smoother, so you don't always hear him coming, but he'll do anything to keep his range free.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm worried what he's going to do when he finds out you boys are back.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You mean you ain't coming with Emmett and me?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I can't say I'm convinced you're going anywhere.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sure we are. We're leaving at dawn.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I've got no reason to run. It was a fair fight and there were plenty of witnesses.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, that's what happened with me too.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: The other guy drew first.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Right!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Didn't he tell you about Blind Pete?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: We didn't get that far.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Blind Pete taught me a great trick.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's the longest I ever did it. 'Bout bust a gut.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What now?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We wait.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Where's your brother?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: He'll be here.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: This a friend of yours?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: He is now.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Oh, a guy who got run out of town...

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Get out of here, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: All I did was kiss the girl.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: That's what you said in Turley. You remember how that ended.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What's the matter, Paden? You afraid I couldn't get those two behind me?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I don't want you getting anyone in my place.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: New record.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Kelly, get over here.  You didn't come all this way just to pay me back that money, did you?  Kelly, meet my friend Paden.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Howdy.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Give the man a line of credit. He already owes the house thirteen bucks.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You wanted to see me?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: We're going to make some adjustments. I wanted you to be here when I offered Paden your job. I think he could do it without getting greedy. Stella and I are tired of you skimming our profits.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I'm done talking. Get out.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You can't do this.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: There are three strangers in this room, traveller, and these gents you are accusing aren't them.  Are these your friends?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: I wanted a drink and a bed. I guess I came to the wrong place.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Came to the wrong town. I don't tolerate this kind of thing. It's hard on the peace, and it's hard on the furniture. Now, knowing a bit about Carter here, I'm going to let you go without paying for the damages. But go you will, and I mean now.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Is there a place in town that takes... my kind?

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: You misunderstand. I want you out of town. In fact, I want you all the way out of my jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: That ain't right.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: I decide what's right in this jurisdiction. Now move.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: What's all this then?

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: This nigger's breaking up my place, Sheriff Langston.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: I don't like that word much, Carter.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: We don't serve them here and you know it. I asked him to leave and he went crazy on us. He owes me money for this damage.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Is that a fact?

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Who's going to pay for all this, Sheriff?

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Don't press your luck, Carter.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Now let's talk about you chaps.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: We'd rather stay.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: We'll see about that. I'm Sheriff John Langston. As you may have guessed, I am not from these parts.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: But the good citizens of Turley have taken me in their embrace, and for one simple reason. I maintain the peace. So when strangers come to town, I always ask them their business. Have you come for the hanging?

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: The jury saw it differently.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: So this is the guy you're going to hang?

turns.speaker: LANGSTON
turns.text: Tomorrow morning. Ten o'clock.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I was afraid of that.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Hello, Rae.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: What are you doing here? I thought you were done with our family.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Daddy's dead.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: He was murdered.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Who did it?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: I'm not sure, but I got an idea. And when I am sure, they're going to pay.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Oh that's just fine. Where were you when Ma and Daddy needed you? It's too late, Mal. Now you finally show up and all you can think of is to get yourself killed.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: What are you doing here, Rae? This ain't for you.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: It's none of your business.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Rae, all we got is each other.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: I don't have any family any more.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Get out. We have nothing to talk about.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Rae, I need help.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Why come to me?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Because you're my sister. There's nobody else.  The men who killed Daddy are after Jake. I gotta talk to him.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: What's stopping you?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: They're watching the Hollis place. I can't get through.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: What makes you think I could?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Why would they stop you?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Because I'm your sister.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Why him?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Shut up. You need help, don't you?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: This is it, gents. My ma told me to head south past that rock.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Good luck, Mal.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Why are they doing this, Mal?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Because they enjoy it.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I heard from Stella you were trying to find Jake. What happened to Emmett?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: You don't know?

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: I got there just short of too late.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Lucky.

turns.speaker: MAL
turns.text: Yeah, it's working out real good.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Where's Emmett now?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: He must be pretty good.

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: He's good, all right. Too good for my men. That's why you've got to take care of it.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: What about his brother?

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: We'll handle that. He's careless.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Things are getting messy around here.  I hear Ezra Johnson got himself killed.

turns.speaker: MCKENDRICK
turns.text: I heard that too.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Did you hear his son is still around?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Hello, Cobb.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Hello, Paden. How ya doing?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I see you're prospering without me.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: It's been a while.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Where's the dog?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Appreciate the loan. I'm good for it.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Let's talk about that.  I'm looking for some men.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I've given that up.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: So have I. I've got a legitimate job now. I can use a guy like you.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You've got a legitimate job.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Yes, sir. You wouldn't believe it.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: This is mighty sweet, Paden. I think I finally found my place in the world.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Well I'm real happy for you, Cobb. But I think I'll keep looking for mine.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: You got a place to stay?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I just got to town.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Stella, we still got an extra room out back, don't we?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: What brings you into my saloon?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Luck, I guess.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Good old Paden. I was hoping you'd changed your mind about the job.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You didn't tell me you owned a saloon.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Nothing like that will happen between us.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Maybe we ought to ask Stella.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I took out thirteen dollars.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: This is a lot of money.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I told you this was a sweet set-up.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: It is that.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Maybe you could run it without Stella.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Easy, boy. Just an idea.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Well, thanks, but forget it.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: You know, Paden, what makes all this work is me doing my job. The fellows you came to town with are causing some trouble. It's going to take a little straightening out. I have my responsibilities. I want you to understand. It has nothing to do with us.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What is it you want from me?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Nothing. Do nothing. Don't get between us.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I'm a great believer in doing nothing.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: So we understand each other?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Don't worry about me. If you're taking on Emmett, the last place I want to be is between you.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I'm going to have to look into this.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Yeah, maybe I will too.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I thought we talked about that.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: We didn't talk about this.  They took the little boy, Cobb.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: You gotta calm down, Paden. Everything will be put straight in a few days.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I saw how you're putting Mal Johnson straight.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I never could count on you to be reasonable.  Don't force me to make an adjustment around here.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Cobb, you've got nothing I need.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I'm not thinking about your future, Paden. I'm worried about Stella.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What's she got to do with it?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Not a thing. She's just a mutual friend.  But if you wind up on the wrong side of this, she's going to get hurt.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: What a waste. This could have been such a sweet deal for us.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Yeah. Bad luck.  Good-bye, Cobb.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Good-bye, Paden.
